text: Wolfgang Kusserow Wolfgang Kusserow (1 Mar 1922-28 Mar 1942) was executed by guillotine at Brandenburg-Görden Prison for conscientiously objecting induction into the German Army because of his religious beliefs as a Jehovah's Witness. == Family == Kusserow was one of eleven children born to Franz Karl Paul Kusserow and Hilda Emma (Eichhorst) Kusserow in Bochum, Germany a family of Jehovah's Witnesses that were persecuted for their religion during the Nazi regime."Purple Triangles: The True Story of a German Family" Directed by Martin Smith, Peter Williams TV International Ltd., 1991. US Holocaust Memorial Museum, Special Collection: Steven Spielberg Film and Video Archive, Film, Accession Number: 1993.178.1, RG Number: RG-60.2715, Film ID: 414. A documentary about the fate of the Kusserow family in Germany during WWII.
